ygData.subject: Re: Digest Number 5
ygData.msgSnippet: About the Polished Tomahawk in HP that thing will cost a fortune too. The spawn is rare and the axe itself is very rare. I can t see you getting this for less
ygData.messageBody:
About the Polished Tomahawk in HP that thing will cost a fortune too. The
spawn is rare and the axe itself is very rare. I can't see you getting this
for less than 100pp and that's if your lucky. Your best bet would be to try
and get a high level friend to get one for you at a knock down price.


Kordin Barbarian Warrior
E'ci

cash

>Subject: Re: pp gp sp cp. why dont I have any?

>hmmm cutthroats are good, they have bronze sometimes, but you need a party
>at your level. The places become better for cash the higher you are.
>
>You could also try the Gorge of King Xorbb, minotaurs there, a full party
of
>level 10 may be able to take down a gorge, with luck perhaps a chasm. They
>generally drop gold, sometimes plat and sometimes they drop axes which you
>can sell to PC's
>

>Message: 5
> Date: Mon, 17 May 1999 17:10:54 +0900
> From: "Mifsud, Michael" <Michael.Mifsud@...>
>Subject: Re: pp gp sp cp. why dont I have any?
>
>No it, the closest city is Riverdale.
>
>So goto Riverdale, then make you way from Misty Thicket to Runnyeye
dungeon,
>enter the dungeon stick right until you zone -BOOM- you have entered the
>gorge of King Xorbb (or Beholders Maze). You should be able to find a
group
>there to join, DO NOT try and kill a gorge with just 2 level 9 people, you
>will die. Gorge minotaurs are about level 14 or 15.
>
>Jaade.
>

>Greets!
>
>Snyak on Innoruuk here - you should be able to get plenty of swords off
>the gnolls in Black Burrow Paw. You might want to save up several and then
>look for some one to sharpen one for you. That was my plan until I caved
in
>and bought a mino axe <g> no way you can't love 8 dmg & 35 dly!
>
>Otherwise - save that plat and buy one. In the meantime, using the rusty
>one will help build your skill fo rthe time when you can get a good one.
>
>

>Message: 11
> Date: Mon, 17 May 1999 09:18:55 -0400
> From: "Zwanenburg, John" <ZWANENJ@...>
>Subject: Spoiler on a weapon!
>
>Hey all,
>
>Back from the weekend to find my mail box overflowing hehe...
>
>Hey i was looking at the EQ site at www.gamez.net/eq (great site) and i saw
>the most amazing weapon....so id you dont want to read a spoiler dont
scroll
>down!!!!
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
>Ok this weapon is 35 damage 45 speed, 2h slashing, also it randomly cast 4
>High end wizard spells! can you belive that , not little spells like shock
>of frost, but biggies like comet and stuff...! Yeah anyhow, this was
>supposed to be a paladin only weapon but the changed that since beta, so
far
>no one has the weapon yet....because its nearly impossible to get. I THINK
>you have to kill lord mistmoore for it...and yeah well hes a level 53
>vampire lord so...hehe good luck. Anyways yeah im drooling now, arent
you???
>John Zwanenburg
>Tips Support/Support Sipt
>Tel: (613) 998-2745
>

>Message: 15
> Date: Mon, 17 May 1999 09:48:39 -0400
> From: Kelly Pruett <pruett@...>
>Subject: A question on kill stealing.
>
>Hi all,
>I've been a roleplayer and a mudder for years now. I've come to EQ like
>most of us, with a lot of experience in multiplayer gaming. Now, I'm
>fairly new to EQ (level 8) but I thought I had a good understanding of
>it, and it's unwritten rules, until now.
>
>The other night I was in BlackBurrow in a small group of 3. Two of us
>were at the bottom level, and I was up top, returning from a town run. I
>saw a gnoll guardsman kill someone, so I ran up to take charge of it.
>There was nobody else around it. After a few hits it fled to the lower
>level with me chasing it every step, hacking and kicking. Upon reaching
>the lower level, there was a mini train already down there, but both me,
>and the members of my group, were working on the gnoll guardsman I had
>chased down. Towards the end of the fight, a fighter type of some sort
>walked up and took the final swing on the guardsman. Thinking I had done
>it ( I had to scroll back to look afterward) I bent over and looted the
>corpse.
>
>The fighter started complaining at once that I was a kill stealer and I
>took his loot. I explained to him that I had chased the monster down,
>and had done the most damage, and therefore the computer LET me take my
>kill. He respnded that HE had chased the monster down from the top (I
>never even saw anyone up top but myself) and had made the kill therefore
>it wasn't mine to take. I didn't feel like the argument was worth it so
>I gave up and tried to trade him the loot. He would not accept, but
>instead complained to me via tells that he couldn't believe I did that.
>
>My questions are:
>1.) Was I ethically wrong to take the loot?
>2.) Does the game only allow the majority damage dealer to take the
>loot, or the final swinger?
>3.) How would you guys deal with this situation?
>
>Thanks for any advice ....
>-Faderic of Qeynos (Ellorisi Marr server)
>
>
>
>

____
>___________________________________________________________________________
____

>>From: Kelly Pruett <pruett@...>
>>
>>Hi all,
>>I've been a roleplayer and a mudder for years now. I've come to EQ like
>>most of us, with a lot of experience in multiplayer gaming. Now, I'm
>>fairly new to EQ (level 8) but I thought I had a good understanding of
>>it, and it's unwritten rules, until now.
>>
>>The other night I was in BlackBurrow in a small group of 3. Two of us
>>were at the bottom level, and I was up top, returning from a town run. I
>>saw a gnoll guardsman kill someone, so I ran up to take charge of it.
>>There was nobody else around it. After a few hits it fled to the lower
>>level with me chasing it every step, hacking and kicking. Upon reaching
>>the lower level, there was a mini train already down there, but both me,
>>and the members of my group, were working on the gnoll guardsman I had
>>chased down. Towards the end of the fight, a fighter type of some sort
>>walked up and took the final swing on the guardsman. Thinking I had done
>>it ( I had to scroll back to look afterward) I bent over and looted the
>>corpse.
>>
>>The fighter started complaining at once that I was a kill stealer and I
>>took his loot. I explained to him that I had chased the monster down,
>>and had done the most damage, and therefore the computer LET me take my
>>kill. He respnded that HE had chased the monster down from the top (I
>>never even saw anyone up top but myself) and had made the kill therefore
>>it wasn't mine to take. I didn't feel like the argument was worth it so
>>I gave up and tried to trade him the loot. He would not accept, but
>>instead complained to me via tells that he couldn't believe I did that.
>>
>>My questions are:
>>1.) Was I ethically wrong to take the loot?
>>2.) Does the game only allow the majority damage dealer to take the
>>loot, or the final swinger?
>>3.) How would you guys deal with this situation?
>>
>>Thanks for any advice ....
>>-Faderic of Qeynos (Ellorisi Marr server)
>>
>>
>>

>Message: 22
> Date: Mon, 17 May 1999 09:54:37 -0400
> From: "Zwanenburg, John" <ZWANENJ@...>
>Subject: Re: A question on kill stealing.
>
>You have nothing to worry about..
>
>if you could loot the corspe then the kill is most certainly yours, it
means
>that YOUR party had done the majority of the damage...a simple way to find
>out f the kill is yours is to merely see if you get any experience from
>it,(providing it doesnt con green to you) if you do then you got the kill,
>the EXP and with that comes the loot, most people often try to dispute
this,
>but you cant....next time he whines to you, duel him =)
>John Zwanenburg
>Tips Support/Support Sipt
>Tel: (613) 998-2745
>

>Message: 24
> Date: Mon, 17 May 1999 09:19:49 -0500
> From: James Schuldes <jgs@...>
>Subject: Re: A question on kill stealing.
>
>Greets Faderic!
>
>BB is a mad house sometimes.
>
>The situation you may want to watch out for is "helping" someone kill a mob
>when the person you are trying to "help" wants to do it solo for the xp.
If
>you join a fight in progress, you may inflict more damage and get the kill
>and thus the other guy does not get the xp from the fight.
>
>What I do is target the mob and then target the other guy. Assess if he
>needs help by looking at the difference in hp - this may be the 2nd or 3rd
>mob he has been fighting and even though it's a scrawny, he maybe low on hp
>and would like some help.
>
>BB is where some people go for loot - others go there for the high MD.
>There are usually lots of kills laying around free for anyone to loot. And

>even some dead guards and elites just laying t<br/><br/>(Message over 64 KB, truncated)
